Package io.github.zero88.schedulerx.trigger.rule

Interface Timeframe<T>

Type Parameters:
T - Type of time frame value
All Known Implementing Classes:
InstantRange, LocalDateRange, LocalDateTimeRange, LocalTimeRange, OffsetDateTimeRange, OffsetTimeRange
public interface Timeframe<T>
A particular period of time in which a trigger can be emitted.
Since:
2.0.0

  • Method Details

    • from

      @NotNull static <T, TF extends Timeframe<T>> TF from(@NotNull T from)
      Obtains an instance of Timeframe by from.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of time frame value
      TF - Type of time frame
      Parameters:
      from - a minimum allowed value (inclusive)
      Returns:
      new instance of timeframe that allows a time starts from to the given from value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the given from value is null

    • to

      @NotNull static <T, TF extends Timeframe<T>> TF to(@NotNull T to)
      Obtains an instance of Timeframe by to.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of time frame value
      TF - Type of time frame
      Parameters:
      to - a maximum allowed value (exclusive)
      Returns:
      new instance of timeframe that allows a time is until to the given to value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the given to value is null

    • of

      @NotNull static <T, TF extends Timeframe<T>> TF of(T from, T to)
      Obtains an instance of Timeframe by from value and to value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - Type of time frame value
      TF - Type of time frame
      Parameters:
      from - a minimum allowed value (inclusive)
      to - a maximum allowed value (exclusive)
      Returns:
      new instance of timeframe, not null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if unable to parse the given values
      UnsupportedOperationException - if unknown timeframe type

    • create

      static <TF extends Timeframe<?>> TF create(String type, Object from, Object to)
      Obtains an instance of Timeframe by type of timeframe value, and the agnostic values: from and to.
      Type Parameters:
      TF - Type of timeframe
      Parameters:
      type - a type of timeframe value
      from - a minimum allowed value (inclusive)
      to - a maximum allowed value (exclusive)
      Returns:
      new instance of timeframe, not null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if unable to parse the given values
      UnsupportedOperationException - if unknown timeframe type

    • create

      static <TF extends Timeframe<?>> TF create(Map<String,Object> properties)
      Obtains an instance of Timeframe
      Type Parameters:
      TF - Type of timeframe
      Parameters:
      properties - the arbitrary key value from json
      Returns:
      new instance of timeframe, not null
      API Note:
      This method supports Jackson deserialization

    • type

      @NotNull @NotNull Class<T> type()
      Returns:
      type of timeframe value, should be a subclass of Temporal

    • from

      @Nullable T from()
      Returns:
      minimum allowed value (inclusive)

    • to

      @Nullable T to()
      Returns:
      maximum allowed value (exclusive)

    • check

      boolean check(@NotNull @NotNull Instant instant, @NotNull @NotNull Duration leeway)
      Verify the given time is in range of from() and to() within allowable time margin.
      Parameters:
      instant - a given time that is an instantaneous point on the time-line
      leeway - a leeway time
      Returns:
      true if the given time is in range, otherwise is false

    • parser

      @NotNull @NotNull TimeParser<T> parser()
      Returns:
      a time parser

    • validator

      @NotNull default @NotNull TimeframeValidator validator()
      Returns:
      a timeframe validator

    • set

      @NotNull @NotNull Timeframe<T> set(@NotNull @NotNull String field, @Nullable @Nullable Object value)
      Set property value in the timeframe.
      Parameters:
      field - the timeframe field. E.g: "from", "to", and other extra proprieties
      value - the property value
      Returns:
      a reference to this for fluent API
      API Note:
      This method is useful to implement the custom timeframe. When using this method with the builtin timeframe, UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown
